metadata.dc:title: IRS Migration Database
metadata.dc:creator: Janine Billadello
metadata.dc:subject: Tax returns--United States
Tax exemption--United States
Migration
United States. Internal Revenue Service. Statistics of Income Division
Counties
metadata.dc:description: This SQLite database compiles county to county migration data produced by the IRS Statistics of Income Division (SOI) for the years 1990 - 2015. When a filer submits a tax return, the address for that year is compared to the filerâ€™s address in the previous year. If the two addresses differ, the filer is considered to have moved. The IRS SOI division generates inflow tables (total number of filers who moved into counties) and outflow tables (total number of filers who moved out of counties) for each year. In addition to the inflow and outflow data tables, summary tables were added to the final SQLite database; these separate the aggregate total number of migrants per county in each year from the raw data tables. The annual nature of this dataset makes it valuable for the study of migration patterns within the United States over time.
metadata.dc:source: Substantial Changes to Counties and County Equivalent Entities: 1970-Present
